verbs.description: undevil (third-person singular simple present undevils, present participle undeviling or undevilling, simple past and past participle undeviled or undevilled)

entries.meaning: (archaic, transitive) To free from possession by a devil or evil spirit; to exorcise.
examples: The boy having gotten a habit of counterfeiting  […]  would not be undevilled by all their exorcisms.
